com.guidewire.util.webservices
Class CmdLineToolBase

java.lang.Object
  com.guidewire.util.webservices.CmdLineToolBase

public abstract class CmdLineToolBase
extends java.lang.Object

CmdLineTooBase will automatically parse server URL, username, password from command line, and will log in and log out before and after an API call. You can do all this yourself, but it's a nice starting point for creating a command line tool that accesses a particular API.

For example, if you want to update fields on a claim to fix broken integration with the Mainframe you could extend this class and wrap the IDataObject API. You would require two parameters (in addition to the password) called xpath and value in order to set fields on a claim.

execute

public abstract void execute(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine line,
                             java.lang.String serverURL,
                             java.lang.Object proxy)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException,
                             java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             java.net.MalformedURLException,
                             javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException,
                             org.xml.sax.SAXException
Executes the command line. Must be implemented by overriding class.

Parameters:
line - constructed command line with all options.
serverURL - the URL of the server.
proxy - the proxy object. You should cast this to the type passed to the constructor.
Throws:
org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
java.io.IOException
java.rmi.RemoteException
java.net.MalformedURLException
javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException
org.xml.sax.SAXException

getOptionsOneRequired

public abstract org.apache.commons.cli.Option[] getOptionsOneRequired()
Subclasses must provide an array of Options; if none of the options returned by this array are contained in the command line, then parsing will fail.

Returns:
an array of Options, one of which must be in the command line for parsing to succeed.

trimListValues

public static java.lang.String[] trimListValues(java.lang.String[] vals)
Utility method to clean up an array of values. Trim is called on every string and if the resulting string is empty, it is removed from the list.

Parameters:
vals -
Returns:
the trimmed strings

Parameters:

Returns:
A nice description of the duration in day, hours, minutes, and seconds

getProxy

public static java.lang.Object getProxy(java.lang.Class apiClass,
                                        java.lang.String serverURL)
                                 throws javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException
Returns a proxy of the given type.

WARNING: This method returns a proxy that is not thread safe. Each thread should have its own instance of the proxy.

This method should only be used if you want low level access to the SOAP layer. I.e. you want to control login for some reason. Instead the method 

executeSOAPOperation
should be used instead.

Parameters:
apiClass - the class you are getting a proxy to
serverURL - the URL of the server.
Returns:
a handle to the proxy.
Throws:
javax.xml.rpc.ServiceException - if the proxy cannot be instanciated for any reason.
